functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

I'll help you find this information by searching for relevant Wikipedia content.

*2024–25* →

All statistics correct as of 12 November 2023. |


The **2023–24 Premier League** is the 32nd season of the Premier League and 125th season of top-flight English football overall. The fixtures were announced on 15 June 2023 at 09:00 BST.[1] Manchester City are the three-time defending champions, and can become the first men's club in the history of the English top-flight to win four titles in a row, if successful.


This season is the third to feature a winter break, with no Premier League matches scheduled between 14 and 30 January 2024.[2] The summer transfer window lasted between 14 June and 1 September 2023. The Premier League's winter transfer window will open on 1 January 2024 and will close at 23:00 GMT on 1 February 2024.[3]

Twenty teams are competing in the league – the top seventeen teams from the previous season and the three teams promoted from the Championship. The promoted teams are Burnley, Sheffield United, and Luton Town, who will return to the top flight after respective absences of one, two and thirty-one years. This is also Luton Town's first season in the Premier League.[5]
With their promotion, Luton Town is the first team to have been promoted from non-league (5th tier or lower within the English football league pyramid) to the top flight during the Premier League era. They will replace Leicester City, Leeds United, and Southampton, who were relegated to the Championship after respective spells of nine, three and eleven years in the top flight.

msg.name: search

msg.content:
Based on the Wikipedia search results, here are all the Premier League teams based in London for the 2023/24 season along with their home stadiums:

1. Arsenal - Emirates Stadium (located in Holloway, London)
2. Brentford - Gtech Community Stadium (located in Brentford, London)
3. Chelsea - Stamford Bridge (located in Fulham, London)
4. Crystal Palace - Selhurst Park (located in Selhurst, London)
5. Fulham - Craven Cottage (located in Fulham, London)
6. Tottenham Hotspur - Tottenham Hotspur Stadium (located in Tottenham, London)
7. West Ham United - London Stadium (located in Stratford, London)

These seven clubs represent London in the 2023/24 Premier League season, making London the city with the most teams in the Premier League.

I'll help you find this information by searching for relevant Wikipedia content.
